sections.summary: Allah, the Almighty and Wise, inspires the Prophet just as He inspired those who came before him, asserting His **Sublime** authority over all that exists in the heavens and earth. The angels celebrate His praise and seek **forgiveness** for those on earth from the Merciful Lord.

The **Arabic Quran** was revealed to warn the Central City of the Day of Assembly, where humanity will be divided between the Garden and the Furnace. Allah is the ultimate **Protector** who initiates life, provides for His servants, and created mates in pairs to multiply creation.

Allah prescribed a single **religion** for all prophets, including Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, commanding that they uphold it without becoming divided. The Messenger is directed to invite people to this faith, remain **upright**, and judge between conflicting parties with absolute **equity** [392–393].

Arguments against Allah are invalid once the truth is established, and the **Balance** has been sent down to prepare humanity for the proximity of the **Hour**. Believers who work righteousness are promised the supreme blessing of the Gardens, while the harvest of the **Hereafter** is increased for those who desire it over worldly gain.

Allah accepts the **repentance** of His servants, remits their sins, and answers those who believe and work righteousness [393–394]. He manages the **provisions** of the world with expertise, sending down rain in precise measure to unfold His mercy.

The movement of **ships** through the sea like flags serves as a visible sign of divine control over the natural world. Allah holds the power to still the winds or wreck these vessels as a consequence of human actions, yet He **pardons** much.

Believers are characterized by their avoidance of major sins, establishing prayer, and conducting their affairs through **mutual consultation (Shura)** [394–395]. While **retaliation** for an injury is permitted in equivalent measure, the text emphasizes that **patience** and forgiveness represent signs of real resolve.

Those whom Allah leaves astray find no protector or way of return once they witness the **torment** of the Day of Resurrection. Allah maintains absolute **dominion** over life, choosing to grant daughters, sons, or sterility to whomever He wills [395–396].

Allah communicates with humans through direct **inspiration**, from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger to reveal His will. The Prophet is guided spiritually to lead humanity to the **straight path** of Allah, to whom all matters ultimately revert.
